title: Where can i find Lettering
content: I was wondering if anyone could tell me where i could find some examples of lettering. Similiar to the Art lettering Chris Robertson did in the Post TYPE BATTLE: Week 2 (23 Jan.) I want to practice drawing lettering like this.
author: orso2932

comments.content:
Ohhhh…you didn’t read: Typophile Forums Answers to FAQs aka General Posting Guidelines? :)

see the Wiki miki - books

david’s referring to [http://typophile.com/faqs](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094503/http:/typophile.com/faqs) and [books](http://web.archive.org/wiki/books)

A great book on lettering: Leslie Cabarga’s _[Logo Font and Lettering Bible](http://web.archive.org/wiki/logo_font_and_lettering_bible)_.
no im not trying to design a font but just hand lettering. Mainly just examples.

[http://re-type.com/notaweblog/?p=29](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094503/http:/re-type.com/notaweblog/?p=29)

[http://re-type.com/notaweblog/?p=42](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094503/http:/re-type.com/notaweblog/?p=42)

[http://re-type.com/notaweblog/?p=38](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094503/http:/re-type.com/notaweblog/?p=38)

[http://re-type.com/notaweblog/?p=31](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094503/http:/re-type.com/notaweblog/?p=31)

[http://www.stephenraw.com/letterforms/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060210094503/http:/www.stephenraw.com/letterforms/index.html)

The book ‘Creative Lettering Today’ by Michael Harvey is focus on hand lettering. I think it’s one of the best available. The Bill Gray’s book (Lettering tips for…) is also a good resource.  
Cheers.  
Ramiro.
